answers.answer: I'm having my second one later this year, both times due to preeclamplsia.
One friend had hers due to low lying placenta completely covering her cervix and another friend as her baby's head couldn't fit through her pelvis.

Preeclampsia, baby in breech position, multiple babies in your pregnancy, umbilical cord wrapped around baby's head or neck, fetal or mother in distress, baby's heart beat dropping, baby won't fit through your pelvis, gestational diabetes, very large baby, etc
How did you know you had preeclamplsia?

First baby they knew I had it at 28wks because bp was 170/140, I was swollen all over, blinded by white spots, and protein in urine. This time they were looking for it every appointment and at 15wks bp suddenly went to 160/90, I put on 13lbs, swollen up again, white spots and pritein in urine.
My mom had to get a c section aftr they broke her water bcus i jus wasnt coming out naturaly
I had one due to my baby being breech. I also had preeclampsia but could've had a vaginal delivery if the baby wasn't breech.

The biggest reason is because of a previous c section. Other than that, placental issues (previa or abruption), "failure to progress" (which can mean a lot of different things depending on your provider and hospital), baby is too big to deliver vaginally (really rare for that  to actually happen), active herpes outbreak, hiv positive or aids patient, etc.
Oh and breech duh, and multiple births. Depends on your provider if they'll "allow" you to birth breech or twins/triplets vaginally.

I've had csections due to my pelvic bone being tilted because of a curve at the bottom of my back due to scoliosis I will be having my third csection in 12 days and I'm definitely ready as he will be my third and last

question: What are some reasons for someone to have a C section?
title: c section
